requirements.body:
Guideline
This page lists recommended environments. Even if it works, usability may be worse on smaller screens.

Supported browsers (recommended)

Google Chrome / Microsoft Edge 111+ (latest recommended)
Mozilla Firefox 114+ (latest recommended)
Safari (macOS / iOS) 16.4+ (equivalent to iOS 16.4+)
Unsupported Internet Explorer (not supported due to React 18)

Screen size & resolution (recommended)

PC
Full HD (1920×1080) or higher Display scaling under 125%
The board, pieces in hand, and chat are easier to see side by side.
Phone
Full HD (1920×1080) or higher Taller than 16:10 (portrait recommended)
iPhone SE (2nd gen) works, but the screen is small, so it is not recommended.

Notes

  • Mouse/keyboard input is recommended (touch input also works).
  • To avoid disconnects during games, we recommend using a stable network connection.
Back to Home About & Rules Contact
requirements.desc: Recommended environment for smooth play and analysis.
reset.error.password_need_digit: Password must include at least one digit.
reset.error.password_need_lower: Password must include at least one lowercase letter.
reset.error.password_need_upper: Password must include at least one uppercase letter.
reset.error.password_too_short: Password must be at least 8 characters.
reset.error.token_missing: Token not found. Please reopen the link from the email.
reset.error.token_revoked: Token is invalid (it may have been re-issued).
reset.form.pw.label: New password
reset.form.pw2.label: New password (confirm)
rules.about.li1: This site is not intended as a replacement for Shogi Club 24. For ordinary match play, the more established 81道場, lishogi, Shogi Wars, and Shogi Quest are recommended.
rules.about.li2: This site is not for profit. No ads, payments, or donation prompts.
rules.about.li3: Teaching games, small tournaments, study groups, club activities, and other settings with a clear purpose are recommended.
rules.about.p1: Created for learning—study, analysis, and teaching games—after Shogi Club 24 shut down. The rules and operation policy are based on the culture and customs of that site.
rules.about.title: About
rules.callout.body: This site is a non-profit service for learning and交流 with others. We do our best to operate it, but we are not responsible for any loss or disadvantage caused by using the site (game results, connection issues, data loss, etc.).
rules.desc: This page summarizes the site’s purpose, operating policy, and rules.
rules.rules.basic.li1: The goal is to checkmate the opponent king.
rules.rules.basic.li2: Illegal moves such as leaving your king in check, moving into check, or double pawn are not allowed.
rules.rules.chat.li1: Abusive chat such as harassment, threats, discrimination, stalking, baiting, or spamming is subject to an immediate ban (admin discretion).
rules.rules.chat.li2: Respect and consideration for your opponent is a given. Use greetings, watch your language, avoid rapid-fire messages, and keep things comfortable for everyone.
rules.rules.manners.li1: Actions likely to make your opponent uncomfortable—even if allowed by the rules, such as stalling until right before timeout or moves like bishop no-promote—should, as a courtesy to your opponent, generally be avoided. However, we generally do not punish these actions by themselves.
rules.rules.p1: To ensure games can be played comfortably, we set a minimum set of rules. Details not written here follow standard shogi conventions and common sense.
rules.rules.title: About the rules
rules.rules.trouble.li1: We are not responsible for disadvantages caused by personal disputes. Please resolve trouble between the parties involved.
rules.rules.trouble.li2: Do not share personal information (address, phone number, SNS accounts, etc.) or encourage others to do so.
verify.desc: Verify your email address for your account.
verify.error.token_missing: Token not found. Please reopen the link from the email.
verify.error.token_revoked: Token is invalid (it may have been re-issued).
rules.about.notes.title: Notes
rules.about.notes.callout.title: Operations & data
rules.about.notes.callout.body: Service content, rules, and stored data (such as game records) may be changed or removed without notice for operational reasons.
rules.about.notes.li1: The service may be temporarily unavailable due to maintenance.
rules.about.notes.li2: To prevent abuse, we may restrict access (room lock / ban, etc.) without prior notice if necessary.
rules.rules.basic.li3: For details not covered here, follow standard shogi rules and common practice.
rules.rules.time.title: Time control (Wait time)
rules.rules.time.p1: Choose a time control when creating a game. We describe it using: main time / byoyomi / Fischer increment / grace (extra time used after byoyomi is exceeded).
rules.rules.time.row.hayasashi.name: Quick
rules.rules.time.row.hayasashi2.name: Quick 2
rules.rules.time.row.hayasashi2.desc: Byoyomi 30 sec (priority) / Grace total 1 min after byoyomi is exceeded
rules.rules.time.row.hayasashi3.name: Quick 3
rules.rules.time.row.15min.name: 15 min
rules.rules.time.row.30min.name: Long
rules.rules.time.note: Note: “Grace” is extra time consumed only after byoyomi is exceeded, and it is a total pool (it does not reset each move).
rules.rules.nyugyoku.title: Entering king (27-point method + site rules)
rules.rules.nyugyoku.p1: We follow the 27-point method with additional site rules. Entering-king is judged automatically.
rules.rules.nyugyoku.win.title: Entering-king declaration: Win
rules.rules.nyugyoku.win.p1: Before move 256, if your king is in the opponent camp (their last 3 ranks), you win if either condition holds:
rules.rules.nyugyoku.win.li1: (Declaration) You have 10+ pieces (excluding the king) in the opponent camp, your king is not in check, and your points (pieces in camp + pieces in hand) are >= 28 (sente) / >= 27 (gote).
rules.rules.nyugyoku.win.li3: (Long-game measure) Total points on board + in hand are 44+ (site rule).
rules.rules.nyugyoku.low.title: Entering-king declaration: Lose (insufficient points)
rules.rules.nyugyoku.low.li1: If your king is in the opponent camp but your total points on board + in hand are below 10, you lose (site rule).
rules.rules.disconnect.title: Loss by disconnection
rules.rules.disconnect.li1: Disconnection timeout: the disconnected side loses if disconnection exceeds the allowed time.
rules.rules.disconnect.li2: Disconnection count reached: the side loses if the total disconnection count reaches the threshold.
rules.rules.draw.title: Move limit
